name: Yttrium(III) chloride
desc: Yttrium(III) chloride is an inorganic compound of yttrium and chloride. It exists in two forms, the hydrate (YCl3(H2O)6) and an anhydrous form (YCl3). Both are colourless solids that are highly soluble in water, and deliquescent.
Solubility:
60.1 g/100 mL ethanol (15 °C)
60.6 g/100 mL pyridine (15 °C)[1]
Other anions:
Yttrium(III) fluoride
Yttrium(III) bromide
Yttrium(III) iodide
Other cations:
Scandium(III) chloride
Lanthanum(III) chloride
Actinium(III) chloride
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
